ch.epfl.sdp.peakar.camera

Class CameraUiView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • ch.epfl.sdp.peakar.camera.CameraUiView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, java.util.Observer

    public class CameraUiView
extends android.view.View
implements java.util.Observer
    CameraUiView draws a canvas with the compass and mountain information on the camera-preview

    • Constructor Detail

      • CameraUiView

        public CameraUiView(android.content.Context context,
                    android.util.AttributeSet attrs)
        Constructor for the CompassView which initializes the widges like the font height and paints used
        Parameters:
        context - Context of the activity on which the camera-preview is drawn
        attrs - AttributeSet so that the CompassView can be used from the xml directly

    • Method Detail

      • getBitmapFromVectorDrawable

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmapFromVectorDrawable(android.content.Context context,
                                                                  int drawableId)

      • setDegrees

        public void setDegrees(float horizontalDegrees,
                       float verticalDegrees)
        Set the horizontal and vertical degrees for the compass and markers. When setDegrees is called, it updates the canvas calling invalidate() and requestLayout() which redraws the view.
        Parameters:
        horizontalDegrees - set the horizontal heading in degrees
        verticalDegrees - set the vertical heading in degrees

      • setRange

        public void setRange(androidx.core.util.Pair<java.lang.Float,java.lang.Float> cameraFieldOfView)
        Sets the range in degrees of the compass-view, corresponds to the field of view of the camera
        Parameters:
        cameraFieldOfView - Pair containing the horizontal and vertical field of view

      • setPOIs

        public void setPOIs(java.util.Map<POIPoint,java.lang.Boolean> labeledPOIPoints)
        Set the POIs that will be drawn on the camera-preview
        Parameters:
        labeledPOIPoints - Map of the POIPoints with the line of sight boolean

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        onDraw method is used to draw the compass on the screen. To draw the compass, 3 different types of lines are used, mainLinePaint, secondaryLinePaint and terciaryLinePaint. The compass is drawn by going through a for-loop starting from minDegree until maxDegrees. They correspond to the actual heading minus and plus half of the field of view of the device camera.
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas on which the compass is drawn

      • getDiscoveredPOIPoints

        public java.util.List<POIPoint> getDiscoveredPOIPoints()
        Gets the new discovered peaks
        Returns:
        List of the new discovered peaks

        public android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap()
        Get a bitmap of the compass-view

        a bitmap of the compass-view
